intro: Praravinia pubescens, commonly known as the hairy praravinia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, four-petaled flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in wetlands. Praravinia pubescens plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is considered a rare species in its native habitat.
